content.question:
The function g is continuous for all real numbers x and is defined by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mtext> for </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≠</mo> <mn>0.</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4C0F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

(a) Use L’Hospital’s Rule to find the value of g(0). Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text:
The function g is continuous for all real numbers x and is defined by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mtext> for </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≠</mo> <mn>0.</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4C0F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

(a) Use L’Hospital’s Rule to find the value of g(0). Show the work that leads to your answer.
(b) Let f be the function given by f(x) = cos(2x). Write the first four nonzero terms and the general term of the Taylor series for f about x = 0.
(c) Use your answer from part (b) to write the first three nonzero terms and the general term of the Taylor series for g about x = 0.
(d) Determine whether g has a relative minimum, a relative maximum, or neither at x = 0. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
